001package imagingbook.pub.geometry.moments;
002
003import java.util.HashSet;
004import java.util.Set;
005
006import imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic;
007import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
008
009/**
010 * This class defines static methods for moment calculations on 2D point sets.
011 * TODO: make more efficient versions!
012 * 
013 * @author WB
014 *
015 */
016public abstract class Moments2D {
017
018        public static double ordinaryMoment(Iterable<Pnt2d> points, int p, int q) {
019                double Mpq = 0.0;
020                if (p == 0 && q == 0) { // just count the number of points
021                        for (@SuppressWarnings("unused") Pnt2d pnt : points) {
022                                Mpq += 1;
023                        }
024                }
025                else {
026                        for (Pnt2d pnt : points) {
027                                Mpq += Math.pow(pnt.getX(), p) * Math.pow(pnt.getY(), q);
028                        }
029                }
030                return Mpq;
031        }
032
033        public static double centralMoment(Iterable<Pnt2d> points, int p, int q) {
034                double a = ordinaryMoment(points, 0, 0); // region area
035                if (Arithmetic.isZero(a)) {
036                        throw new RuntimeException("empty point set");
037                }
038                double xCtr = ordinaryMoment(points, 1, 0) / a;
039                double yCtr = ordinaryMoment(points, 0, 1) / a;
040                double cMpq = 0.0;
041                for (Pnt2d pnt : points) {
042                        cMpq += Math.pow(pnt.getX() - xCtr, p) * Math.pow(pnt.getY() - yCtr, q);
043                }
044                return cMpq;
045        }
046        
047        public static double normalizedCentralMoment(Iterable<Pnt2d> points, int p, int q) {
048                double a = ordinaryMoment(points, 0, 0);
049                double scale = Math.pow(a, 0.5 * (p + q + 2));
050                return centralMoment(points, p, q) / scale;
051        }
052        
053        
054        public static void main(String[] args) {
055                Set<Pnt2d> points = new HashSet<>();
056                points.add(Pnt2d.from(10, 15));
057                points.add(Pnt2d.from(3, 7));
058                points.add(Pnt2d.from(-1, 5));
059                points.add(Pnt2d.from(-1, 5));
060                System.out.println("set size = " + points.size());
061                
062                System.out.println("m00 = " + ordinaryMoment(points, 0, 0));
063                System.out.println("m10 = " + ordinaryMoment(points, 1, 0));
064                System.out.println("m01 = " + ordinaryMoment(points, 0, 1));
065                
066                double a = ordinaryMoment(points, 0, 0);
067                System.out.println("a = " + a);
068                System.out.println("xc = " + (ordinaryMoment(points, 1, 0) / a));
069                System.out.println("yc = " + (ordinaryMoment(points, 0, 1) / a));       
070                
071                System.out.println("mu10 = " + centralMoment(points, 1, 0));
072                System.out.println("mu01 = " + centralMoment(points, 0, 1));
073                System.out.println("mu11 = " + centralMoment(points, 1, 1));
074                System.out.println("mu20 = " + centralMoment(points, 2, 0));
075                System.out.println("mu02 = " + centralMoment(points, 0, 2));
076        }
077        
078}
079
080/*
081set size = 3
082m00 = 3.0
083m10 = 12.0
084m01 = 27.0
085a = 3.0
086xc = 4.0
087yc = 9.0
088mu10 = 0.0
089mu01 = 0.0
090mu11 = 58.0
091mu20 = 62.0
092mu02 = 56.0
093*/
